title: Kate Hudson shows off her slender post-baby body as she poses topless
text:
Kate Hudson showed off her slender figure in a new topless image shared to Instagram on Monday.

The daughter of Goldie Hawn wrapped her arms around her bare chest as she modeled a pair of high-waited black jeans from her new clothing line HappyxNature.

The 40-year-old Bride Wars star has lost all the baby weight from her third child Rani Rose Hudson Fujikawa, aged one, thanks to WW - formerly known as Weight Watchers - after she became the global ambassador in 2018.

Risky business: Kate Hudson has showed off her slender figure in a new topless image shared to Instagram on Monday

The blonde star, who came to fame in Almost Famous and will next star in Mona Lisa And The Blood Moon, looked like a Malibu-born beauty.

The movie star had bright blonde hair with an even tan.

Kate has lost so much weight this year her rib cage could be seen as her tiny waist was on display.

More to this picture: The blonde star, who came to fame in Almost Famous and will next star in Mona Lisa and the Blood Moon, looked like a Malibu beauty

The jeans looked like they were XS and they were also cinched at the waist with a wide black belt that had a round silver buckle.

There were many rings on her fingers as she posed against a wall with peeling paint.

Her new clothing line HappyxNature launched this year.

Funny: The caption for the image read: 'West coast vs. East coast fall styling for my Ultra Highwaist Corset Skinny Jean. Which coast do you lean...? #90degrees #60degrees'

On her website Kate writes: 'Our goal is simple – making you and nature happy with easy, free-spirited fashion that minimizes our impact on non-renewable resources. From the factories and mills we choose to packaging and garment tags, we'll explore every option, always looking for eco-aware solutions. The skinny jeans is using 2 plastic bottles... Recycled.'

The caption for the image read: 'West coast vs. East coast fall styling for my Ultra Highwaist Corset Skinny Jean. Which coast do you lean...? #90degrees #60degrees.'

This comes after the How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days star shared an image with Rani.

Now with her top on: The siren also posed with this blue blouse as she walked down a flight of stairs

The cover girl had a pacifier in her mouth as she held the child while shopping in a store.

Earlier this month Kate discussed maintaining her weight and living a balanced lifestyle after giving birth to her third child last year.

Speaking to The Sun Herald, the 40-year-old actress said: 'It's about understanding your food and maintaining a healthy lifestyle.

'Being part of a community and having support.'

Shopping queen: This comes after the How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days star shared an image with Rani. The cover girl had a pacifier in her mouth as she held the child

Kate explained that she also eats healthy meals and makes informed decisions when it comes to food.

She said that it's not just about losing weight but more about wellness.

'I've always been a very healthy eater and I'm very knowledgeable about nutrition but I use the app to look things up that I'm not sure about.'

Meanwhile, Kate was announced as a global ambassador for WW in December last year - two months after giving birth to her third child.

What a lovely trio: Kate was flanked by Cara Delevingne, left, and Jameela Jamil, right, at the 2nd Annual Girl Up #GirlHero Awards at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons Hotel on October 13

Speaking to People at the time, she said 'it came at a perfect time' because it gave her the opportunity to focus on herself.

'It's hard when you have babies. Everyone comes before you, and you have to find that time to just focus in on yourself,' she told the publication.

'One of my passions in life is wanting people to live their most optimum life, whether it be in health or in happiness,' she said.

She said that as an ambassador she hopes to inspire others to live a more balanced and healthier lifestyle.

'I am excited to walk down a street and have someone come up and say they're a part of the community, because it means they're doing something good for themselves.'
